title: Alum Bay and Headon Warren Walk Route

images.title: Peter Trimming / Bench With a View
images.caption: Bench With a View. Views of Hurst Castle on the left, Fort Albert near the centre of picture, and Alum Bay and Hatherwood Point in the foreground.

images.title: John Rostron / Heathland on Headon Warren
images.caption: Heathland on Headon Warren. This shows a rich crop of Bell Heather on Headon Warren. The tall yellowish flowers are Mullein. The bushes to the top right are Gorse.

images.caption: Headon Warren

description: This walk visits Alum Bay, Headon Warren and Headon Hill in the south western corner of the Isle of Wight. You can start the walk from the Alum Bay car park and then follow a section of the Isle of Wight Coast Path up to the Warren. There's some nice footpaths here with excellent views to The Needles and pretty bell heather in the late summer. The area is also great for wildlife with breeding birds on the cliffs including peregrine falcon, fulmar, kittiwake, cormorant, shag, razorbill, puffin and guillemot. You can extend the walk by heading west to visit the Needle Old Battery on the tip of the island. There's also a tourist chairlift which you can ride for some amazing views.
